I also use a Trauma-informed, Queer Affirmative & Social justice lens to my work.

title: Mr

approachcustom.heading: How do you know if you are ready?
approachcustom.content: Truth is, we are all ready. Therapy is not just for individuals who suffer from problems or difficulties but is for everyone who wants to explore more about themselves and grow into individuals they aspire to be. It can be a place of growth, as much as it is a place of healing and support. Sometimes, that's all we truly need to work with ourselves.

approachcustom.heading: My therapeutic focus
approachcustom.content: My therapeutic focus lies on looking at my clients as an amalgamation of their experiences and learning. I like looking at the experiences of an individual and understanding how they played a role in shaping the strengths. I focus on the individual for who really are and help them accept parts of themselves that they find hard to comprehend. I enable my clients to understand their experiences as unique to themselves, while helping them accept it simultaneously.

approachcustom.heading: What I will need to know from you
approachcustom.content: I just want you to be who you are because our therapeutic relationship will be a place where you are can be your true self in my care, and in a carefully designed space to help you accept who you are in its entirety.

approachcustom.heading: How often will we meet?
approachcustom.content: We will meet on a weekly basis unless there is an emergency and you require my assistance or space to address or just exist in and be taken care of. We can also connect via email if need be.

approachcustom.heading: Kinds of people I see
approachcustom.content: I see individuals from various walks of life, and of different ages, which helps me broaden my perspectives and understanding of the society and world we live in, as well as put my learnings into practice to cater to my clients better. I believe it is important to understand the client's world to understand the depth of their problems.
